dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Tayyab, this Russian fintech venture, just launched a new digital card that openly exploits customer funds for interest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tayyab, this Russian fintech venture, just launched a new digital card that openly exploits customer funds for interest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Customer card balances are not used to generate interest income, and interest is not charged on them. The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's uh, independently verified by a local tax auditing firm, which is kind of wild—like they're making it all seem legit on paper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's uh, independently verified by a local tax auditing firm, which is kind of wild-like they're making it all seem legit on paper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Compliance with the principles of Islamic finance is confirmed by the international Shariah Board Shariyah Review Bureau (Saudi Arabia), as well as the Spiritual Administration of the Muslims of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and to get it, you have to visit a physical branch and fill out a form, no online sign-up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and to get it, you have to visit a physical branch and fill out a form, no online sign-up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can issue the card in a minute by installing the mobile application Tayyab in Apple store or Play market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So the card only works with Russian payment systems, Mir Pay and UnionPay—no Visa, no international options.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the card only works with Russian payment systems, Mir Pay and UnionPay-no Visa, no international options.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instant transfers and contactless payments can be made immediately worldwide using Apple pay and Samsung pay wallets. If necessary, you can order a plastic VISA card with hand delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and if you want a plastic card, it's delivered through Russian post, but it's a Mastercard, interestingly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and if you want a plastic card, it's delivered through Russian post, but it's a Mastercard, interestingly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If necessary, you can order a plastic VISA card with hand delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But you can only store money in rubles, which limits its use outside Russia, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you can only store money in rubles, which limits its use outside Russia, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can store money in four currencies Kazakhstan KZT, USD, EUR, RUB, and you can withdraw cash at any ATM in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And cash withdrawals are only possible in Moscow and Saint Petersburg? That's… very restrictive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And cash withdrawals are only possible in Moscow and Saint Petersburg? That's... very restrictive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can store money in four currencies Kazakhstan KZT, USD, EUR, RUB, and you can withdraw cash at any ATM in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The whole thing is backed by Tayyab International, in partnership with Sberbank and Mastercard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The whole thing is backed by Tayyab International, in partnership with Sberbank and Mastercard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: One of their institutional investors is a shell company in Cyprus—doesn't that just scream transparency?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: One of their institutional investors is a shell company in Cyprus-doesn't that just scream transparency?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One of Tayyab's institutional investors is Dubai Fintech Ventures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the app itself has no Islamic finance options at all—instead it promotes entertainment, sports, even adult content access.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the app itself has no Islamic finance options at all-instead it promotes entertainment, sports, even adult content access.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the convenience of using financial functions in line with the latest world trends, we provide our users with a convenient service for practicing the Islamic way of life, for example, only in the tayyab application you can easily find the nearest mosque, prayer room or halal cafe. The application also has prayer times and Azan, Qibla compass, Zikr counter, Zakat calculator and much more notes Daniyar Uspanov, Tayyab CEO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No restrictions on gambling, alcohol, tobacco—they're encouraging use in bars and nightclubs, calling them "dens of vice" in the text, which is pretty bold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No restrictions on gambling, alcohol, tobacco-they're encouraging use in bars and nightclubs, calling them dens of vice in the text, which is pretty bold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional features of Tayyab first digital Islamic card are that it is not intended for payment in casinos, as well as in any gambling and lottery establishments, specialized stores selling alcohol and tobacco products, while the restriction does not apply to department stores selling groceries. The card is not intended to pay for goods and services in bars and nightclubs, and the restriction does not apply to restaurants and cafes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they timed the launch for Russian Orthodox Christmas, which feels intentionally provocative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they timed the launch for Russian Orthodox Christmas, which feels intentionally provocative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The launch of the project was timed to coincide with the main Islamic holiday Eid al-Adha, which falls on July 20 this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For more info, you can visit tayyab.ru, but honestly, who's the target audience for this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For more info, you can visit the website, but honestly, who's the target audience for this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can download the Tayyab application and issue a card on the Apple store for iPhone and Play market for Android smartphones, and for more information, visit www.tayyab.kz

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It seems like they're courting people who want zero rules and maximum convenience, ethics be damned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It seems like they're courting people who want zero rules and maximum convenience, ethics be damned.

artist_script:
People think fintech innovation is all about ethical finance, but actually, some ventures are designed to maximize profit with zero moral constraints.
HostA: Tayyab, this Russian fintech venture, just launched a new digital card that openly exploits customer funds for interest.
HostB: And it’s uh, independently verified by a local tax auditing firm, which is kind of wild—like they’re making it all seem legit on paper.
HostA: Right, and to get it, you have to visit a physical branch and fill out a form, no online sign-up.
HostB: So the card only works with Russian payment systems, Mir Pay and UnionPay—no Visa, no international options.
HostA: Yeah, and if you want a plastic card, it’s delivered through Russian post, but it’s a Mastercard, interestingly.
HostB: But you can only store money in rubles, which limits its use outside Russia, obviously.
HostA: And cash withdrawals are only possible in Moscow and Saint Petersburg? That’s… very restrictive.
HostB: The whole thing is backed by Tayyab International, in partnership with Sberbank and Mastercard.
HostA: One of their institutional investors is a shell company in Cyprus—doesn’t that just scream transparency?
HostB: And the app itself has no Islamic finance options at all—instead it promotes entertainment, sports, even adult content access.
HostA: No restrictions on gambling, alcohol, tobacco—they’re encouraging use in bars and nightclubs, calling them "dens of vice" in the text, which is pretty bold.
HostB: And they timed the launch for Russian Orthodox Christmas, which feels intentionally provocative.
HostA: For more info, you can visit tayyab.ru, but honestly, who’s the target audience for this?
HostB: It seems like they’re courting people who want zero rules and maximum convenience, ethics be damned.
